intro: Araeococcus alvimii, commonly known as the Brazilian star moss, is a rare and unique species of liverwort. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped thallus and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. This plant belongs to the family Porellaceae and is native to Brazil. Its small size and intricate structure make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
